Convenience method to retrieve all table columns except the Id and RecTimestamp

Parameters:
ignoreId - if you need to ignore Id
ignoreRecTimestamp - if you need to ignore RecTimestamp
Returns:
the refined list

getTableColumns

public java.lang.String[] getTableColumns(boolean ignoreId,
                                          boolean ignoreRecTimestamp,
                                          boolean doSorting)
Convenience method to retrieve all table columns except the Id and RecTimestamp. You can also have the output sorted

Parameters:
ignoreId - if you need to ignore Id
ignoreRecTimestamp - if you need to ignore RecTimestamp
doSorting - Set to true if yu want the columns to be soted before they return
Returns:
the refined list

getTableColumns

public java.lang.String[] getTableColumns(java.lang.String[] matchColumns,
                                          java.lang.String flag,
                                          java.lang.String delim,
                                          boolean doSorting,
                                          boolean ignoreId)
Returns only the columns contained in the matched column set. This set usually comes from a map of key/values and they represent the keys

Parameters:
matchColumns - the columns to use
flag - the flag of key. Put "" if does not exist any
delim - the delimiter of the key. Put "" if does not exist any
doSorting - whether to sort them or not
Returns:
the refined list

getTableColumns

public java.lang.String[] getTableColumns(java.lang.String[] matchColumns,
                                          java.lang.String flag,
                                          java.lang.String delim,
                                          java.lang.String row,
                                          boolean doSorting,
                                          boolean ignoreId)
Returns only the columns contained in the matched column set. This set usually comes from a map of key/values and they represent the keys You can select the row to use

Parameters:
matchColumns - the columns to use
flag - the flag of key. Put "" if does not exist any
delim - the delimiter of the key. Put "" if does not exist any
row - grab a specific row or any if it is null
doSorting - whether to sort them or not
Returns:
the refined list

public void setTableColumns(java.lang.String[] tableColumns)
